headline: Black Bean and Corn Salad
description: This black bean and corn salad is very colorful and includes a delicious lime and garlic dressing. Makes a great side dish for any occasion.

video.description: See how to make a fresh, colorful Mexican-inspired side dish.
video.name: Black Bean and Corn Salad II

name: Black Bean and Corn Salad
recipeIngredient: 2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Place olive oil, lime juice, garlic, salt, and cayenne pepper in a small jar. Close the lid tightly and shake the jar until the dressing is well combined.
Combine in a salad bowl beans, corn, avocado, bell pepper, tomatoes, green onions, and cilantro.
Shake dressing again, pour over salad, and toss to coat.

review.reviewBody: This was super filling and delicious . I love the colors as well as the nutrition. AND super easy to make.

Bold fresh flavor, zero cooking on a hot day, nutritious and vegetarian! Delicious. Having no scallions or bell peppers, I substituted a little red onion and hatch peppers. That was good, but next time I'll do the recipe "straight".

Recipe is delicious and was a big hit at the cookout. I did increase the lime juice to 1/2 cup and decreased oil to about 1/3 cup per recommendations from other reviews and it came out perfect. I will definitely make this again.

I did read the reviews, I agreed with most the changes, and of course, it boils down to personal preference. I've made enough salads to know, a 1/2 cup is way too much oil, a quarter to third cup is fine. Also, someone mentioned, (and you can look it up), adding the avocado pit has nothing to do with keeping the avocado from turning brown. It's the Citric acid alone in the lime juice that keeps the avocado from turning brown. Look it up. For the tomato, I went ahead and just added it. The only difference, I did not include the center watery portion, with the seeds and all. That is what makes it more watery. I used Roma tomato's and patted them lightly with a paper towel. I'll be making this again. I made it ahead of time, the flavors relax and blend together, IMO.
I’ve made it twice now. Super easy and super good. I’m always a little short on one or two ingredients and it still turns out good so it’s very forgiving
I liked it. I didn't have all the ingredients, so I substituted cilantro with hot sauce. No peppers and reduced the olive oil.
colorful and fresh.
Delicious! Received compliments from everyone who ate it.

First time I made this I followed directions as written with one exception. I used vidalia sweet onions sense I live in Georgia. I gave it a five star rating for the original recipe. The second time I made it I used fresh not frozen corn cut right off the cobb. Roma tomatoes and allot more garlic as suggested. Both were really good either way. I think letting this sit in the fridge over night is the secret to this recipe. So good the next day. YUMMMY
I made one change when I made this; instead of making the dressing, I used a bottled salsa salad dressing with cotija cheese and it was the perfect salad for a summer barbecue.

I like more of a corn/black bean balance, so I only added one can of bean. I also followed another reviewer’s suggestion and only put in half the oil. I think I could have reduced the lime juice too. Overall, its a good recipe and I’ll use it again.
Always a crowd pleaser! I make it up a few hours ahead of time, omitting the avocado and adding it right before serving.
Increased garlic and cayenne to our liking. I didn't have enough lime juice so used mostly lemon. Have made with all lime before and it was good both ways.
Just yummy! Perfect for a May 5th potluck; serve in small bowls or ramekins as the dressing is liquid, and cilantro on the side because some people don't/can't eat it.
I have been using this recipe for a couple years now. I get compliments every time I bring it to a gathering with a bag of tortilla chips. It’s fresh, light and delicious.
I love how simple this recipe is and it provides great flavor!
My guests at Olievenhoutsrus Guest And Game Farm loved it
Delicious! I substituted garbanzos instead of beans and it was still delicious!
Absolutely delicious! Made it exactly as written. Easily scalable to 3 servings which left me with some extra avocado for lunch the next day!
I followed the recipe to a T and can't figure out why it came out so spicy. It shouldn't have been. Good anyway, but I couldn't eat it all because of the heat.

What a delicious salad! It's perfect to act as a side for almost anything you want to pair it with! I would, however, (personal choices here), switch the amounts of lime juice and oil and use more than the two good-sized corn cobs that I used. This was a huge hit with my whole family! Thanks for the recipe!!
Great summer recipient. . I used fresh corn since corn is now in season. Boiled the corn for three minutes and cooled on ice water before stripping the kernels off the Cobb

I couldn’t stop taste testing while I was making it! So delicious! I actually forgot the oil when I was making it and realized at the end I don’t think I really need it. All the flavors come through so nicely: the beans the corn the tomatoes the cilantro! Yummy!
AMAZING!!!!
I love this recipe! Next time I think I'll add a mango and jalapeno.
Smashing good! I am hooked on this salad. I make it at least once every couple of weeks and eat the whole thing over the course of 4 days. It is SO GOOD!
Excellent recipe! I made it exactly as the recipe is written a few hours ahead of time in order for the flavors to blend.
Omg this was so delicious. Incredibly refreshing!
Easy to make. Adults liked it children not so much. Followed the recipe exactly. Will definitely make again. Very refreshing. Thank you for the recipe. S. S.
This was good, better after it sits overnight.
Loved most of it! But a word of caution on the cayenne -- the fractions as shown are a little wonky if you're adjusting the recipe for 3 or 4 people.

Wonderful mix of tastes and colors. Great mayo-free side salad. I reduce the oil by almost half to reduce the fat/cal. and use 3-4 plum tomatoes. I prepare the dressing ahead but add right b4 serving. I serve the avocado separately as it browns so easily and in my opinion detracts from the otherwise bright colors. Delicious. Leftovers carry well through the next 2days and can be used as is or to top many things. I do strain off the increased liquid b4 using the leftover.
Loved it! I didn't have any avacados or green onions, but I added a pinch of Swerve, 2 tsp of lemon juice and another sprinkle of lime juice and it was delicious! Thank you!
I love this salad. I make it just
Easy and very good!
Loved it... added fresh diced jalapeno pepper for slight kick

I used lemon juice (I had lots of bottled juice on hand) and 1 scallion. Also 1/3 c. olive oil, only 1 can black beans & 1 tsp. dried cilantro, per other reviewers. It made about 2.5 lbs. It's also good with tostito chips.

great recipe!! I use the yellow and red bell pepper and use a sweet onion and fresh corn off the cob. it is awesome!!! 2 cans of black beans is a bit much for me so I only use one and add extra corn. goes great with my chicken enchiladas.

it was a hit! only substitutions : Red onion for green onion, fresh chopped jalapeno

this made enough for 10 of us as a side salad, everyone raved about it.
I have made a similar version of this for decades. Always a hit. Great for a crowd. Served it with shredded beef tacos tonigh.
So good...just added some raw zucchini chunks and charred 2 cobs of corn on the BBQ before cutting it off the cob.
Good alternative to mayo based salads. I added noodles and as leftovers added chopped up kielbasa.

This was better than I expected. I made half the recipe with roasted, canned corn. I squeezed a lime but got maybe an eighth of a cup; so it had limited flavor. I didn't add the cayenne pepper or measure the cilantro
I made this just as the recipe stated. I think the only thing I would do differently next time is add some Cumin and more cayenne.
My husband really like this salad
Liked it a lot. Easy to make. Maybe add a little more lime juice.

I made this exactly as written. I agree that the olive oil could be reduced, especially if one is using a "really good" olive oil with that edge that can take over. And although not a "salt person" I believe it could take just a smidge more. Finally, I always add more garlic, so that suited us, and also a little more cayenne because that, too, suits our tastes. Finally, added avocado on top so that it wouldn't get mushy "in there."

Unbelievably delicious. Turned out way better than I expected. Made enough for hubby and I and man it was gone in minutes. Would have taken a picture but couldn't put my bowl down to do so. Yum yum. Thank you for this.

Fresh and fabulous! I grilled three ears of fresh corn for 10 mins until charred on all sides and cut it off the cob. It added a whole new level of flavor to the dish. I used a 1/2 tbsp of smoked sea salt and 1 tsp of cumin to the dressing. Also zested the lime into the dressing. We served this with lime tortillas as a salsa. Also good on chicken nachos, tacos, and fish tacos!

This is a standard at our house! Because we are low-sodium, we cook dried beans in the pressure cooker and use less salt overall. We also like it with chopped up cucumbers in the mix. There’s often a container of this salad in the refrigerator for handy snacks...
I use juice fresh limes and add a pinch of cumin and 1-2 jalapeños to give it a bit more flavour.
Easy to make and the leftovers are awesome!
This was a delicious and very easy salad to make. I'll definitely make this again.
Absolutely love this salad! Easy to make, the aroma is unbelievable I am already passing recipe on to family members a true Family Favorite!

Terrific recipe. Per some of the reviews i cut the oil in half, doubled the garlic, and used a heavy measure of cilantro. Fresh lime juice a must. The cayenne is a little more present the next day but is still just a bit spicy and not hot. Great hot summer day dish.

Ok qualifier. I just made this. It hasn’t even chilled. It is fabulous. Don’t skimp on the avocado as I tried to do to save some for later. I used half Roma tomatoes and half cherry tomatoes. That was the only change. Delicious!
Followed recipe exactly as written and it was fabulous! Used leftovers as a dip for a couple of days afterwards. sooooo yummy!
I made it as directed except I used can corn. Everyone loved it!
Great as a side with fish tacos or as a dip. I added one large jalapeño, seeded and diced. Yummy!
I didn't have green onions so used red onion and left out the tomatoes so it would save better and it was delicious!!
Delicious! I made it per recipe. Yummy! I can see it as a very versatile salad. Adding orzo, or quinoa would be delicious too!

Whatever you do, do not - I repeat - DO NOT use a juicer to juice your limes! My limes were SO firm there was no way I could choke a tablespoon out of them by hand, let alone a third of a cup. So, I cut off the skins & juiced 3 limes to get 1/3 cup of juice & the acidity was so overbearing! I added more olive oil (I got the healthy expensive stuff) to try to compensate, to no avail. No one in the world hates to throw out food more than I do, but I ended up throwing out the whole dish...grrr! I'm giving it 5 stars because this is a word of caution, not a rating of the recipe! Next time, I'll either make sure my limes are softer, or I might consider that disrespectable plastic lime instead. Again, grrr!
I also added more lime juice and more cilantro and I used the red onions since I didn’t have the green. It was delicious!

I made exactly to recipe except added an extra clove of garlic (personal preference) but halved it (only two of us) is was so vibrant and bright. Not a bean lover but this changed my mind! Made it with Cuban sandwiches and it complimented the sandwich perfectly.

This was outstanding. Made as is, no changes needed. Must use real lime juice, not the green plastic kind. We served with tortilla chips.

Perfect dish to add shrimp, if you want a heartier meal (although it's plenty filling as is). Also, may try putting a little fresh jalapeno next time.
I made according to the recipe but no cilantro. I agree there is too much oil, but it was very good. Will make again with less oil and some chopped celery added.
So delicious. I went easy on the dressing and only put a little oil, salt, pepper, chili powder. Tasted so delicious!
No changes. Looks & taste awesome.

We loved it.l! I did as other reviewers and added more lime juice and less olive oil. Since I hoped to use it the next day I also replaced avocado with a combination of green and red peppers. Turned out just as I hoped...Just what I wanted to serve with Salsa Chicken and Mexican Rice. Thanks for a good one!

I first made it as written, and it is very good. However, I now add a tbsp of ACV to the dressing. It gives it an additional zing which is still there the next day. Also, since we're not cilantro fans, I use some fresh basil. Great picnic food!
The only change I made was adding shredded, grilled chicken and then putting the tortillas to serve as wraps. Massive hit.

Very good! It makes A LOT, so it’s great to take to a potluck. I used some sriracha instead of cayenne, and had to substitute some lemon juice because my limes weren’t very juicy. Still turned out great!

This is ABSOLUTELY delish! Living in a sailboat, I am always looking for fresh dishes that can an be made easily without a lot of heat in the galley. This is a favorite for not just me, but easy to bring to other boats for happy hour events. However, I Cut the oil to half. Otherwise it seems like the ingredients are swimming in it.

Made it. Used a variety of Herbs in the dressing and a lower ratio of lime to oil as it was a bit too acidic for me. Served on a bed of greens%

Very tasty combination
I don't eat a lot of beans, but after making this salad. I was hooked! I love this recipe!

I was out of lime juice, substituted lemon-orange juice, but followed the recipe otherwise. It makes a large bowl and was a big hit! I’d do it again. It would be easy to add and substitute but absolutely no need!!
It was so tasty. We’re not big fans of cilantro, so I left it out. I loved the bit of heat. I can’t wait until summer & be able to use garden tomatoes in it.
I added some dashes of Tajin seasoning just for a little extra pop of flavor and it was amazing!!
Made this (minus the avocado because we didn’t have any) - delicious salad!

Used 1/4 olive oil per other reviews. Subbed red bell peppers for tomatoes just because I don't like tomatoes. The salad was very yummy. Family ate it with tortilla chips as well. We are trying to eat vegan and this salad is perfect with the beans adding protein.
Love it!

Exceptional. Made it just as written 1 day in advance for a Super Bowl Party and it was a major hit. The seasonings are perfect for those who like full flavor but no heat. Served chopped jalapeno on the side for those who wanted heat. Everyone was happy!
Awesome and fresh. Yummy with multigrain tortilla chips from Aldi. Flavor improves with time. Make the day before BUT add avacado just before serving
Was really good. I put 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper. I made this for a pot luck at work and everyone loved it and wanted the recipe.

I didn't add any olive oil and it was still very moist and delicious. I wanted to make this as a snack or meal since I'm on weight watchers. It is soooooo delicious. Since I didnt use the olive oil the only points were for the avacado (which is good, but I'm sure it is good without as well). Eat with a spoon, lip smacking, filling, good.

Next time I'm going to try canned diced tomatoes (save time) to see if it is still as good. I'll try to remember to update this review once I do.
Loved it
I added more red pepper and reduced onion to suit my family tastes. A fantastic side dish to pulled pork. Will make this again for sure.

This was fantastic! As suggested by others I only used half a cup of olive oil. I also left out the avacado as my kids don't eat it. My kids still didn't like the salad but all the adults who tried it loved it.

Held the avocado,Made it in advance . Next day mixed in chunked avocado,topped slices ,added more lime juice , splash of Tabasco .used red minced onion. Was popular. Next time will Add diced green chilies.. and the extra lime .we enjoyed the healthy dish, less oil more lime is best
Such a tasty salad. I omitted the oil and used extra lime and a bit more cayenne for kick. Will repeat this one for sure!!!
Doubled the recipe for a lunch pot luck. Everyone loved it! Nothing leftover.
Absolutely tasty! I agree with previous post to add tomato and avocado at the end before serving it to avoid mushiness. I put it in the fridge for a little while. It’s so delicious and refreshing.
This is very similar to Texas Caviar but the lime really makes it fresh for a nice side dish. The family voted that I keep the recipe.

I have made this several times and served it several different ways. You can use it as a dip with tortilla chips, as a side salad, or as a vegetarian filling in tacos. Any way you choose, it is delicious. I do cut back on the oil, as others have suggested, and use avocado oil instead of olive to bring out the real Mexican flavors. Adjust the heat (cayenne pepper) and spice (cilantro) to your liking.
added barley. delicious

This salad was fantastic! I loved it and everyone at the birthday party loved it as well. It was quick, easy and delicious. I just added a dash more cayenne and some black pepper and it was good to go. But the cilantro and avocado really brought it all together. A great Summer dish.

The only thing I did differently was I did NOT add the avocado (I like avocado OK, just didn't wanna mess with it) and got so hungry while making it that as soon as I stirred it up, I fixed a bowl. SO GOOD!! I'll will definitely make again. Thanks for a great recipe!!
So tasty...got rave reviews from my friends. And I am a terrible cook so that is saying something!
I love this "Black Bean and Corn Salad II." I think I have been making it for 20 years. Thank you Jen for sharing your recipe.
